Package com.amazon.ata.resources.designcomposition.fastgeometry

Class MITPoint2D

java.lang.Object
com.amazon.ata.resources.designcomposition.fastgeometry.MITPoint2D
public class MITPoint2D
extends java.lang.Object
PARTICIPANTS: DO NOT MODIFY. This class represents a third-party dependency. As such, Amazon would have no control over it. This class is provided as an example; it does not actually perform fast geometrical calculations without security issues. It is a stand-in representing code that we do not control, but that we want to enhance and/or modify. Again, DO NOT MODIFY THIS CODE.

    • transform

      public void transform​(double x, double y)
      Updates the point's location by adding the amounts provided. DO NOT MODIFY!
      Parameters:
      x - The X distance and direction to move the point.
      y - The Y distance and direction to move the point.

    • distanceTo

      public double distanceTo​(MITPoint2D p)
      Finds the distance in the XY plane between this point and the given point. In theory, this would use some kind of fast algorithm, avoiding the Math.sqrt() altogether. I'm don't have that magic, so it actually just uses the standard Pythagorean theorem. DO NOT MODIFY!
      Parameters:
      p - The point to calculate distance to.
      Returns:
      the distance in the XY plane between this point and the given point.
